menu.tooltip: JOGWHEEL OPTIONS\nSelect what happens when you scratch on the disc
SKIN LAYOUT\nSelect the layout adapted to your mixing style

button.tooltip: AUDIO PANEL\nShow the equalizers and crossfader fx
VIDEO PANEL\nShow the video source and preview

panel.name: bpm_area
panel.tooltip:
BPM
The BPM (Beats Per Minute) value of a song shows how fast its tempo is
The faster the song, the higher the BPM value

An important part of DJing is to make sure that songs are at the same BPM when you mix them together
That's why DJs use the pitch slider to speed up or slow down songs in order to match their BPM

slider.tooltip:
FILTER
Apply a filter effect to the sound
Turning the knob to the left will keep the bass
Turning the knob to the right will keep the high
Current [value]

FLANGER
Apply a flanger effect to the sound
giving a trembling effect like the sound of a jet
Current [value]

CUT
Apply a cut effect to the sound
hashing the sound in bigger pieces as the effect goes stronger
Current [value]

button.tooltip: BEATGRID\nThe beatgrid effect reorganizes the beats following a preset pattern\nin order to instantly give some cool remix effect
LOOP ROLL\nThe loop roll effect repeats a small snippet of the current track while pressed\nand jump back to the original position on release
DNA SCRATCH\nThe scratch effect uses 'DNA' strings to encode cool scratch routines\nthat can be enacted with a simple click
SAMPLER\nThe sampler let you add cool snippets of sound to your mix
BEATGRID\nClick once to turn on or off\nPress longer to turn on while pressed
BEATGRID\nClick once to turn on or off\nPress longer to turn on while pressed
BEATGRID\nClick once to turn on or off\nPress longer to turn on while pressed
BEATGRID\nClick once to turn on or off\nPress longer to turn on while pressed
LOOP ROLL 1/8\nRoll a loop over 1/8th of a beat
LOOP ROLL 1/4\nRoll a loop over 1/4th of a beat
LOOP ROLL 1/2\nRoll a loop over half a beat
LOOP ROLL 1\nRoll a loop over one beat
BABY SCRATCH\nDo a simple scratch routine without crossfader cuts\nthat just slowly raises the amplitude of the scratches
FLARES SCRATCH\nDo a scratch routine that mixes simple scratches and crossfader cuts
JET SCRATCH\nDo a scratch routine that starts fast and ends up on longer cuts
BACKSPIN\nDo a single movement scratch that imitates pulling a record backward
MIX ASSIST\nLet VirtualDJ deal automatically with the beats synchronization\nso you can focus only on the artistic side of your mix

panel.name: bpm_area
panel.tooltip:
BPM
The BPM (Beats Per Minute) value of a song shows how fast its tempo is
The faster the song, the higher the BPM value

An important part of DJing is to make sure that songs are at the same BPM when you mix them together
That's why DJs use the pitch slider to speed up or slow down songs in order to match their BPM

text.text: If you already know how to mix,
you can select a more advanced layout
